meanings.definition: A state of being extremely dirty and unpleasant, especially as a result of poverty or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house was filled with squalor, with trash scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the restaurant was a scene of squalor, with overflowing garbage bins and foul smells.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character lived in such squalor that even the rats complained about the mess.
meanings.sent4: The squalor of the city streets mirrored the chaos in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The squalor of the old barn was so intense that even the dust seemed to have given up hope.

meanings.definition: A place or situation that is extremely dirty and unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The basement had descended into squalor, with mold growing on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The public restroom was a pit of squalor, with no soap or toilet paper in sight.
meanings.sent3: The camping trip turned into squalor when it rained nonstop for three days.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned factory was a haunting squalor of broken machinery and rusted tools.
meanings.sent5: The squalor of the landfill was overwhelming, with seagulls circling above the piles of trash.
